intro: Adenogyrus krebsii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can branch out into multiple shoots. It thrives in humid, warm environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Adenogyrus krebsii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
